Events

We are an organization supporting scholarship and community-based projects on waste and waste infrastructure in NYC and beyond. Thus, Trash Club has designed some ongoing events. The objectives of these events are to encourage ongoing participation, more sustained engagement, and a lasting impact on both participating individuals and communities.

March 6, 2020

Reading Club with Special Guest: Nabil Hassein

Unsettling the Coloniality of Being/Power/Truth/Freedom: Towards the Human, After Man, Its Overrepresentation — An Argument
Sylvia Wynter

Marx and the Rift in the Universal Metabolism of Nature
John Bellamy Foster

Anatomy of an AI System
Kate Crawford and Vladan Joler

May 14, 2020

Sims Recycling Center Tour

At Sims we’ll see how our recycled material is acquired, broken down, filtered, categorized, then sold for reuse. The facility opened in 2003 and is the first of its kind in NYC, sorting through about 500,000 tons of metal, glass, paper, and plastic each year. More information about Sims: here.
